 14677                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14678                                  
 14679                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14680                                  
 14681                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14682                                  ;
 14683                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 14684                                  ;
 14685                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 14686                                  ;							seg ffff )
 14687                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 14688                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 14689                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 14690                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 14691                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 14692                                  ;
 14693                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 14694                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 14695                                  ;
 14696                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14697                                  
 14698                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14699                                  HMAPtr:
 14700 00001411 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14701                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 14702 00001416 8B3E[8C08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14703                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14704 0000141A 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14705 0000141D 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14706 0000141F 803E[9208]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 14707                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 14708 00001424 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14709 00001426 FF1E[8E08]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14710                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14711 0000142A 8B3E[8C08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14712                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14713                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 14714 0000142E C3                      		retn
 14715                                  
 14716                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14717                                  
 14718                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14719                                  
 14720                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 14721                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 14722                                  
 14723                                  move_sector:
 14724                                  
 14725                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 14726                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 14727                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 14728                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 14729                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 14730                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 14731                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 14732                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 14733                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 14734                                  ;
 14735                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 14736                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 14737                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 14738                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 14739                                  ; back to a byte move.
 14740                                  
 14741 0000142F FC                      		cld
 14742 00001430 51                      		push	cx
 14743 00001431 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 14744 00001434 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 14745 00001438 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14746 0000143A 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 14747 0000143E 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14748 00001440 F3A5                    		rep movsw
 14749 00001442 59                      		pop	cx
 14750 00001443 C3                      		retn
 14751                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14752                                  
 14753                                  movsec_bytes:				
 14754 00001444 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 14755 00001446 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 14756 00001448 59                      		pop	cx
 14757 00001449 C3                      		retn
 14758                                  
 14759                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14760                                  
 14761                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14762                                  
 14763                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 14764                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 14765                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 14766                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 14767                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 14768                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 14769                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 14770                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 14771                                  ;
 14772                                  ; input conditions:
 14773                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 14774                                  ;
 14775                                  ; output:
 14776                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 14777                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 14778                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 14779                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 14780                                  
 14781                                  check_wrap:	
 14782 0000144A 50                      		push	ax
 14783 0000144B 53                      		push	bx
 14784 0000144C 06                      		push	es
 14785 0000144D 57                      		push	di
 14786 0000144E E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 14787 00001451 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 14788                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14789 00001453 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14790                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14791 00001458 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 14792 0000145A 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14793 0000145E 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 14794 00001460 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 14795 00001463 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 14796 00001465 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 14797 00001467 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 14798                                  
 14799                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 14800                                  ; last sector on that track.
 14801                                  
 14802 00001469 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 14803 0000146B 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 14804                                  		; 18/12/2022
 14805 0000146D 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 14806 0000146E 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 14807                                  					; if on	boundary
 14808                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 14809                                  not_on_bound:
 14810 00001470 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 14811 00001473 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 14812 00001475 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 14813 00001477 40                      		inc	ax
 14814 00001478 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 14815 0000147A 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 14816                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14817 0000147D 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14818 00001481 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 14819                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14820                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 14821 00001483 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 14822 00001485 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 14823 00001486 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 14824                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14825 00001488 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 14826                                  
 14827                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 14828                                  
 14829 0000148A 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 14830 0000148C 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 14831 0000148E 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 14832                                  
 14833                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 14834                                  
 14835 00001490 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 14836 00001492 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 14837 00001494 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 14838                                  no_head_bound:				
 14839 00001495 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 14840 00001497 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 14841 00001498 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 14842 0000149A 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 14843 0000149C 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 14844 0000149E 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 14845 000014A1 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 14846 000014A3 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 14847 000014A5 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 14848 000014A7 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 14849 000014A9 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 14850 000014AB D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 14851 000014AD 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 14852 000014AF 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 14853                                  no_wrap:				
 14854 000014B1 F8                      		clc
 14855 000014B2 5F                      		pop	di
 14856 000014B3 07                      		pop	es
 14857 000014B4 5B                      		pop	bx
 14858 000014B5 58                      		pop	ax
 14859 000014B6 C3                      		retn
 14860                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14861                                  
 14862                                  no_wrap_head:				
 14863 000014B7 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 14864 000014B9 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 14865 000014BB EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 14866                                  
 14867                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14868                                  
 14869                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14870                                  
 14871                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 14872                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 14873                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 14874                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 14875                                  ;
 14876                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 14877                                  
 14878                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14879                                  find_bds:	
 14880 000014BD C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 14881                                  fbds_1:					
 14882 000014C1 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14883 000014C5 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 14884 000014C7 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 14885                                  					; go to next bds
 14886 000014CA 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14887 000014CD 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 14888 000014CF F9                      		stc
 14889                                  fdbs_2:					
 14890 000014D0 C3                      		retn
 14891                                  
 14892                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14893                                  
 14894                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14895                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14896                                  doint:
 14897                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14898 000014D1 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14899                                  					; get physical drive number
 14900                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 14901                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 14902                                  		
 14903 000014D4 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14904 000014D6 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14905 000014D8 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 14906                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14907 000014DA 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14908                                  					; get request code
 14909                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 14910 000014DD FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14911                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 14912 000014E0 9D                      		popf
 14913                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 14914                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14915 000014E1 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14916                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 14917                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14918 000014E6 9C                      		pushf
 14919                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14920 000014E7 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14921                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 14922                                  dointdone:				
 14923 000014EA C3                      		retn
 14924                                  
 14925                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14926                                  
 14927                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14928                                  
 14929                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 14930                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 14931                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 14932                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 14933                                  ;
 14934                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 14935                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 14936                                  ;
 14937                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 14938                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 14939                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 14940                                  
 14941                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 14942                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 14943                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 14944                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 14945                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 14946                                  ;.olddx: resw
 14947                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 14948                                  ;.olddd: resd
 14949                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 14950                                  ;end struc
 14951                                  
 14952                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14953                                  
 14954                                  ;   entry conditions:
 14955                                  ;	ah = function
 14956                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 14957                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 14958                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 14959                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 14960                                  ;   output conditions:
 14961                                  ;	no dma violation.
 14962                                  
 14963                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 14964                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 14965                                  ;
 14966                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 14967                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 14968                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 14969                                  
 14970                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14971                                  
 14972                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14973                                  
 14974 000014EB 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 14975                                  
 14976                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14977                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14978                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14979                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 14980                                  
 14981                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14982                                  
 14983                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 14984                                  
 14985                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 14986                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 14987                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 14988                                  
 14989                                  format_special_stuff:
 14990 000014EF 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 14991 000014F4 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 14992 000014F6 53                      		push	bx
 14993 000014F7 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 14994 000014FA E83D04                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 14995 000014FD 5B                      		pop	bx
 14996 000014FE EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 14997                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14998                                  
 14999                                  ; 16/10/2022
 15000                                  
 15001                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 15002                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 15003                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 15004                                  
 15005                                  		; 19/10/2022
 15006                                  ec35_special_stuff:
 15007 00001500 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 15008 00001502 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 15009 00001504 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 15010 00001505 51                      		push	cx
 15011 00001506 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 15012 00001508 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 15013 0000150A D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 15014 0000150C 8406[2005]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 15015 00001510 59                      		pop	cx
 15016 00001511 58                      		pop	ax
 15017 00001512 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 15018                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 15019 00001514 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 15020 00001515 06                      		push	es
 15021                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15022 00001516 2EC41E[EB14]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 15023                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 15024                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 15025 0000151B 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 15026 0000151D 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 15027 00001520 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 15028                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 15029                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 15030 00001524 07                      		pop	es
 15031 00001525 5B                      		pop	bx
 15032 00001526 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 15033                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15034                                  
 15035                                  ; 16/10/2022
 15036                                  
 15037                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 15038                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 15039                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 15040                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 15041                                  
 15042                                  ps2_special_stuff:
 15043 00001528 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 15044                                  					; read driver parm ?
 15045 0000152D 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 15046 0000152F 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 15047                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 15048 00001534 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 15049                                  ps2_30_problem:
 15050 00001536 50                      		push	ax
 15051 00001537 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 15052                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 15053                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15054 00001539 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15055                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 15056                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15057 0000153E 58                      		pop	ax
 15058 0000153F EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 15059                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15060                                  
 15061                                  ; 17/10/2022
 15062                                  ; 16/10/2022
 15063                                  
 15064                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 15065                                  
 15066                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 15067                                  
 15068                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 15069                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 15070                                  
 15071                                  		; 19/10/2022
 15072 00001541 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 15073                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 15074                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 15075 00001542 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 15076                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 15077                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 15078                                  
 15079                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 15080                                  
 15081 00001547 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 15082 0000154A 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 15083 0000154D 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 15084                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 15085                                  format_special_stuff_done:		
 15086 0000154F 803E[2005]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 15087 00001554 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 15088                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 15089                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 15090                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h
 15091 00001556 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15092                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15093                                  		
 15094 0000155B 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 15095                                  		
 15096 0000155C 803E[2D06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 15097                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 15098 00001561 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 15099                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 15100                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so
 15101 00001563 9D                      		popf
 15102 00001564 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 15103                                  ret_from_i13:
 15104 00001566 1F                      		pop	ds
 15105 00001567 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 15106                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15107                                  
 15108                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 15109                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 15110                                  ; a changeline error.
 15111                                  
 15112                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:
 15113 0000156A 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 15114                                  i13_ret_error:				
 15115 0000156C 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 15116 0000156F 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 15117 00001571 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 15118 00001573 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 15119 00001575 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 15120 0000157A 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 15121                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 15122                                  					; never	would
 15123 0000157C 53                      		push	bx
 15124 0000157D BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 15125 00001580 E8B703                  		call	set_changed_dl
 15126 00001583 5B                      		pop	bx
 15127                                  int13b:
 15128 00001584 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 15129 00001585 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 15130                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15131                                  
 15132                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 15133                                  
 15134                                  goterr13:
 15135 00001587 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 15136 0000158A 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 15137                                  goterr13_xxxx:
 15138 0000158C 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 15139 0000158F 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 15140 00001591 803E[2706]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 15141 00001596 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 15142                                  
 15143 00001598 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 15144                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 15145                                  					; (2 = romread)
 15146                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 15147 0000159D 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 15148                                  
 15149 0000159F 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 15150                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 15151                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15152 000015A1 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15153                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15154                                  					; call far 70:797h
 15155 000015A6 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 15156 000015A9 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 15157 000015AB 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 15158 000015AD 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 15159 000015AF 53                      		push	bx
 15160 000015B0 51                      		push	cx
 15161 000015B1 52                      		push	dx
 15162 000015B2 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 15163                                  loop_ecc:
 15164 000015B5 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 15165                                  
 15166                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 15167                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 15168                                  ;
 15169                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 15170                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 15171                                  ; track.
 15172                                  ;
 15173                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 15174                                  ; this request.
 15175                                  ;
 15176                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 15177                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 15178                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 15179                                  ;
 15180 000015B8 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 15181                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 15182                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15183 000015BB 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15184                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15185 000015C0 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 15186 000015C2 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 15187 000015C5 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 15188 000015C7 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 15189 000015CA 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 15190                                  		; 10/12/2022
 15191                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 15192                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 15193 000015CC 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 15194                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 15195                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 15196                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 15197                                  ok11_op:
 15198 000015CE FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 15199 000015D2 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 15200 000015D4 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 15201                                  					; add 200h to address
 15202 000015D6 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 15203 000015D8 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 15204 000015DA EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 15205                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15206                                  
 15207                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 15208                                  
 15209                                  ok11_exit_err:
 15210 000015DC F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 15211                                  ok11_exit:
 15212 000015DD 5A                      		pop	dx
 15213 000015DE 59                      		pop	cx
 15214 000015DF 5B                      		pop	bx
 15215 000015E0 EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 15216                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15217                                  
 15218                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 15219                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 15220                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 15221                                  
 15222                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:
 15223 000015E2 06                      		push	es
 15224 000015E3 53                      		push	bx
 15225 000015E4 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 15226 000015E7 1E                      		push	ds
 15227 000015E8 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 15228 000015E9 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 15229                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 15230                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15231 000015EC 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15232                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15233 000015F1 5B                      		pop	bx
 15234 000015F2 07                      		pop	es
 15235 000015F3 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 15236 000015F5 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 15237 000015F8 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 15238                                  
 15239                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 15240                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 15241                                  
 15242                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:
 15243 000015FA 56                      		push	si
 15244 000015FB 57                      		push	di
 15245 000015FC 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 15246 000015FE BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 15247 00001601 E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 15248 00001604 5F                      		pop	di
 15249 00001605 5E                      		pop	si
 15250 00001606 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 15251                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15252                                  
 15253                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 15254                                  ; operation as best we can.
 15255                                  
 15256                                  gotdmaerr:
 15257 00001608 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 15258 0000160B FB                      		sti
 15259 0000160C 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 15260 0000160F 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 15261                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 15262                                  					; functions we don't handle
 15263 00001611 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 15264 00001614 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 15265 00001616 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 15266 00001619 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 15267 0000161B 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 15268                                  
 15269                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 15270                                  
 15271                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 15272                                  
 15273 0000161D 52                      		push	dx
 15274 0000161E 51                      		push	cx
 15275 0000161F 53                      		push	bx
 15276 00001620 50                      		push	ax
 15277 00001621 55                      		push	bp
 15278 00001622 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 15279 00001624 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 15280 00001626 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 15281 00001628 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 15282 0000162A D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 15283 0000162C D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 15284 0000162E 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 15285 00001630 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 15286                                  
 15287                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 15288                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 15289                                  
 15290 00001634 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 15291 00001636 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 15292                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15293                                  
 15294                                  no_skip_first:
 15295 00001639 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 15296 0000163B B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 15297 0000163D 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 15298                                  
 15299                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 15300                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 15301                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 15302                                  ;
 15303                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 15304                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 15305                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 15306                                  ; in error.
 15307                                  
 15308 0000163F 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 15309 00001641 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 15310                                  
 15311                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 15312                                  
 15313 00001643 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 15314                                  					; set up head number
 15315 00001646 E888FE                  		call	doint
 15316 00001649 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 15317                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15318                                  
 15319                                  i13_done_dmaerr:
 15320 0000164C B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 15321 0000164E F9                      		stc
 15322 0000164F E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 15323                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 15324                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15325                                  
 15326                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 15327                                  
 15328                                  intverify:
 15329 00001652 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 15330 00001653 53                      		push	bx
 15331 00001654 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 15332 00001655 07                      		pop	es
 15333                                  dosimple:
 15334 00001656 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 15335                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 15336                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 15337                                  		; 17/10/2022
 15338 00001659 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 15339                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 15340 0000165E 5B                      		pop	bx
 15341 0000165F 07                      		pop	es
 15342 00001660 E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 15343                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15344                                  
 15345                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 15346                                  
 15347                                  intformat:
 15348 00001663 06                      		push	es
 15349 00001664 53                      		push	bx
 15350 00001665 56                      		push	si
 15351 00001666 57                      		push	di
 15352 00001667 1E                      		push	ds
 15353                                  
 15354                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 15355                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 15356                                  
 15357 00001668 06                      		push	es
 15358 00001669 1E                      		push	ds
 15359 0000166A 07                      		pop	es
 15360 0000166B 1F                      		pop	ds
 15361 0000166C 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 15362 0000166E BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 15363 00001671 E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 15364 00001674 1F                      		pop	ds
 15365 00001675 5F                      		pop	di
 15366 00001676 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 15367 00001677 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 15368                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15369                                  
 15370                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 15371                                  ; the first block.
 15372                                  ;
 15373                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 15374                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 15375                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 15376                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 15377                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 15378                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 15379                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 15380                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 15381                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 15382                                  
 15383                                  doblock:
 15384                                  
 15385                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 15386                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 15387                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 15388                                  				
 15389 00001679 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15390                                  					; get head #, drive #
 15391 0000167C 51                      		push	cx
 15392 0000167D 06                      		push	es
 15393 0000167E 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 15394                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 15395 0000167F E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 15396 00001682 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 15397                                  		; 12/12/2022
 15398 00001686 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 15399                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 15400 0000168B 5F                      		pop	di
 15401 0000168C 07                      		pop	es
 15402 0000168D 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 15403 0000168F 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 15404 00001691 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 15405 00001693 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 15406                                  doblockflop:
 15407 00001695 59                      		pop	cx
 15408                                  doblockcontinue:
 15409 00001696 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 15410 00001698 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 15411 0000169A 50                      		push	ax
 15412 0000169B 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 15413 0000169D EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 15414                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15415                                  
 15416                                  doblocklast:
 15417 0000169F 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 15418 000016A1 50                      		push	ax
 15419                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot
 15420 000016A2 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 15421 000016A5 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 15422 000016A7 58                      		pop	ax
 15423 000016A8 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 15424                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 15425 000016AB 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 15426 000016AD 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 15427 000016AF 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 15428 000016B1 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 15429 000016B3 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 15430                                  					; then we are done already.
 15431 000016B5 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 15432                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 15433 000016B7 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 15434 000016BA EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 15435                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15436                                  
 15437                                  bufferx:
 15438 000016BC 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 15439                                  					; set up head number
 15440                                  buffer:
 15441 000016BF 53                      		push	bx
 15442 000016C0 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 15443 000016C3 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 15444 000016C6 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 15445                                  
 15446                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 15447                                  
 15448 000016C8 06                      		push	es
 15449 000016C9 1E                      		push	ds
 15450 000016CA 56                      		push	si
 15451 000016CB 57                      		push	di
 15452 000016CC 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 15453 000016CD 06                      		push	es
 15454 000016CE 1F                      		pop	ds
 15455 000016CF 07                      		pop	es
 15456 000016D0 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 15457 000016D3 57                      		push	di		; save it
 15458 000016D4 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 15459 000016D6 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 15460 000016D9 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 15461                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 15462 000016DA 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 15463 000016DB 5E                      		pop	si
 15464 000016DC 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 15465                                  
 15466                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 15467                                  
 15468 000016DD B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15469                                  					; get drive number
 15470 000016DF 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 15471 000016E2 E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 15472                                  					;
 15473                                  					; ah is	function
 15474                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 15475                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 15476                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 15477                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 15478                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 15479 000016E5 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 15480 000016E8 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 15481 000016E9 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 15482 000016EB EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 15483                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15484                                  
 15485                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 15486                                  
 15487                                  doread:
 15488 000016ED 06                      		push	es
 15489 000016EE 53                      		push	bx
 15490 000016EF 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 15491 000016F0 07                      		pop	es
 15492 000016F1 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 15493 000016F4 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 15494 000016F6 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15495                                  					; get drive number
 15496 000016F9 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 15497                                  					; ah = function
 15498                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 15499                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 15500                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 15501 000016FC E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 15502 000016FF 5B                      		pop	bx
 15503 00001700 07                      		pop	es
 15504 00001701 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 15505 00001703 56                      		push	si
 15506 00001704 57                      		push	di
 15507 00001705 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 15508 00001707 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 15509 0000170A E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 15510 0000170D 5F                      		pop	di
 15511 0000170E 5E                      		pop	si
 15512                                  
 15513                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 15514                                  
 15515                                  dotail:
 15516 0000170F 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 15517 00001710 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 15518 00001713 41                      		inc	cx
 15519 00001714 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 15520 00001717 F8                      		clc
 15521 00001718 FEC8                    		dec	al
 15522 0000171A 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 15523                                  
 15524                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 15525                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 15526                                  
 15527 0000171C 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15528 0000171F E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 15529 00001722 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 15530                                  
 15531                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 15532                                  
 15533                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 15534                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 15535                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 15536                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 15537                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 15538                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 15539                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 15540                                  
 15541                                  bad13:
 15542 00001725 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 15543 00001727 5D                      		pop	bp
 15544 00001728 5B                      		pop	bx
 15545 00001729 5B                      		pop	bx
 15546 0000172A 59                      		pop	cx
 15547 0000172B 5A                      		pop	dx
 15548 0000172C 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 15549 0000172E E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 15550                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15551                                  
 15552                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:
 15553 00001731 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 15554                                  
 15555                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15556                                  		; 10/12/2022
 15557                                  		;db 	0
 15558                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15559                                  
 15560                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 15561                                  
 15562                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 15563                                  
 15564                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15565                                  ; MSBIO2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 15566                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15567                                  ; 17/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15568                                  
 15569                                  		; 19/10/2022
 15570                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 15571 00001734 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 15572 00001738 BF[7606]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 15573 0000173B 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 15574 0000173C 07                      		pop	es
 15575 0000173D E910EF                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 15576                                  
 15577                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 15578                                  
 15579                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15580                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 15581                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 15582                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 15583                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15584                                  
 15585                                  install_bds:
 15586 00001740 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 15587 00001741 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 15588                                  
 15589                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 15590                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 15591                                  loop_next_bds:
 15592 00001744 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 15593                                  					; fetch	next bds
 15594 00001746 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 15595 0000174A 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 15596                                  					; drive	with new one?
 15597 0000174D 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 15598 0000174F B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 15599 00001751 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 15600                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 15601 00001755 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 15602 00001758 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 15603                                  					; we don't own it
 15604 0000175D 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 15605                                  					; determine if changeline available
 15606 00001760 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 15607 00001763 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 15608                                  next_bds:
 15609                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 15610 00001767 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 15611 0000176A 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 15612                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 15613                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 15614 0000176C 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 15615 0000176E 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 15616                                  					; install bds
 15617 00001771 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 15618 00001773 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 15619                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 15620                                  					; set next pointer to null
 15621 00001776 1F                      		pop	ds
 15622                                  
 15623                                  ; 01/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:1785h)
 15624                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 15625                                  
 15626                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 15627                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 15628                                  
 15629                                  		; 01/06/2019
 15630 00001777 268A4534                		mov	al,[es:di+52]
 15631                                  		; 22/07/2023
 15632                                  		;mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 15633 0000177B 3A06[2C01]              		cmp	al,[eot]
 15634 0000177F 7603                    		jbe	short _eot_ok
 15635 00001781 A2[2C01]                		mov	[eot],al
 15636                                  _eot_ok:
 15637 00001784 C3                      		retn
 15638

 15644                                  ; 09/12/2022
 15645                                  DRVLET equ drvlet
 15646                                  SNGMSG equ sngmsg

 15649                                  
 15650                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15651                                  ;  ask to swap the disk in drive a:
 15652                                  ;	es:di -> bds
 15653                                  ;	ds -> Bios_Data
 15654                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15655                                  
 15656                                  		; 19/10/2022

 15668 00001791 51                      		push	cx

 15704                                  					; AL = character to display
