 21001                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 21002                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 21003                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 21004                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 21005                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 21006                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 21007                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 21008                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 21009                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 21010                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 21011                                  ;	  stub will go.
 21012                                  ;
 21013                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 21014                                  
 21015                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21016                                  update_arena:
 21017 00000A10 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 21018 00000A11 57                      	push	di
 21019 00000A12 51                      	push	cx
 21020 00000A13 52                      	push	dx
 21021                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21022                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 21023                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21024                                  	; ds = cs 
 21025 00000A14 C53E[6D02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 21026 00000A18 4F                      	dec	di
 21027 00000A19 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 21028                                  						;  before sysvar
 21029 00000A1A 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 21030                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 21031 00000A1C 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 21032 00000A21 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 21033 00000A23 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 21034                                  
 21035                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 21036 00000A25 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 21037 00000A2A 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 21038 00000A2C 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 21039 00000A2E 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 21040 00000A30 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21041                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 21042 00000A32 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 21043                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 21044 00000A36 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 21045 00000A3C 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 21046                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 21047 00000A3E 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 21048 00000A42 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 21049                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21050                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 21051 00000A44 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 21052 00000A47 5A                      	pop	dx
 21053 00000A48 59                      	pop	cx
 21054 00000A49 5F                      	pop	di
 21055 00000A4A 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 21056 00000A4B C3                      	retn
 21057                                  ;
 21058                                  ; M012 : END
 21059                                  ;

 21077                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21078                                  ;
 21079                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 21080                                  ;
 21081                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 21082                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 21083                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 21084                                  ;
 21085                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 21086                                  ;
 21087                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21088                                  
 21089                                  AllocHMA:
 21090                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 21091                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 21092                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 21093                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 21094                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 21095                                  
 21096                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 21097                                  ;
 21098                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 21099                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 21100                                  ;	push	ax
 21101                                  ;	popf
 21102                                  ;	pushf
 21103                                  ;	pop	ax
 21104                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 21105                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 21106                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 21107                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 21108                                  
 21109                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 21110                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 21111                                  
 21112 00000A58 1E                      	push	ds
 21113                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 21114                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 21115                                  	; 21/10/2022

 21117 00000A5C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21118                                  
 21119 00000A5E E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 21120 00000A61 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 21121                                  
 21122 00000A63 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 21123 00000A66 CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 21124                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 21125                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 21126                                  
 21127 00000A68 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 21128                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx
 21129 00000A6C 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 21130                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 21131                                  
 21132 00000A70 B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 21133 00000A72 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 21134                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 21135 00000A75 FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 21136 00000A79 48                      	dec	ax
 21137 00000A7A 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 21138                                  
 21139                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 21140                                  
 21141 00000A7C B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 21142 00000A7E CD15                    	int	15h
 21143                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 21144                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 21145                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 21146 00000A80 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 21147                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 21148                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21149 00000A83 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 21150                                  allocHMA_1:

 21152                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 21153 00000A87 FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 21154 00000A8B 48                      	dec	ax
 21155 00000A8C 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20
 21156                                  
 21157 00000A8E E88501                  	call	IsVDiskInstalled
 21158 00000A91 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 21159                                  
 21160 00000A93 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 21161 00000A96 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 21162 00000A98 26C70610003412          	mov	word [es:10h],1234h ; see if we can really read/write there
 21163 00000A9F 26813E10003412          	cmp	word [es:10h],1234h
 21164                                  	;jne	short grabhma_error ; don't try to load there if XMS lied
 21165                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21166 00000AA6 7401                    	je	short allocHMA_ok	
 21167                                  
 21168                                  ; 11/12/2022
 21169                                  ;	; 11/12/2022
 21170                                  ;	; cf=0
 21171                                  ;	;clc
 21172                                  ;	pop	ds
 21173                                  ;	retn
 21174

 21181 00000AAA C3                      	retn

 21247                                  
 21248                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21249                                  ;
 21250                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 21251                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 21252                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 21253                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 21254                                  ;
 21255                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 21256                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 21257                                  ;
 21258                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21259                                  
 21260                                  StartVDHead:
 21261                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 21262                                  
 21263 00000AD0 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 21264 00000AD4 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 21265 00000AD6 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 21266 00000AD8 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 21267 00000ADA 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 21268                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 21269 00000ADB 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 21270                                  VDiskSig1:
 21271 00000AE2 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 21272                                  
 21273                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 21274                                  
 21275 00000AE7 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 21276                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 21277 00000AED 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 21278 00000AFC 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 21279 00000AFE 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 21280                                  VDInt19:
 21281 00000AFF EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 21282                                  OldVDInt19:
 21283 00000B00 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 21284                                  
 21285                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 21286                                  
 21287                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 21288 00000B04 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 21289                                  VDiskSig2:
 21290 00000B07 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 21291                                  
 21292                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 21293                                  
 21294 00000B0C 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 21295 00000B0F 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 21296 00000B11 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 21297 00000B12 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 21298 00000B14 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 21299 00000B15 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 21300 00000B17 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 21301 00000B19 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 21302 00000B1A 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 21303 00000B1C 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 21304 00000B1E 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 21305 00000B20 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 21306 00000B22 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 21307                                  
 21308                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 21309                                  
 21310                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21311                                  ;
 21312                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 21313                                  ;
 21314                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 21315                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 21316                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 21317                                  ;
 21318                                  ; Inputs : None
 21319                                  ;
 21320                                  ; Outputs : None
 21321                                  ;
 21322                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 21323                                  ;
 21324                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21325                                  
 21326                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 21327                                  
 21328                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 21329 00000B24 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21330 00000B26 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 21331                                  
 21332                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 21333                                  
 21334                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21335 00000B28 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 21336                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 21337 00000B2B 2EA3[000B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 21338 00000B2F A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 21339                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 21340 00000B32 2EA3[020B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 21341                                  
 21342                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 21343                                  
 21344 00000B36 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 21345                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 21346                                  	; 23/10/2022
 21347 00000B38 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4

 21407                                  ;		Clears the first 32 bytes at 1MB boundary

 21409                                  ;		left by previous DOS=HIGH session

 21413                                  struc desc
 21414 00000000 ????                     .seg_lim:	resw	1		; seg limit 64K 
 21415 00000002 ????                     .lo_word:	resw	1		; 24 bit seg physical 
 21416 00000004 ??                       .hi_byte:	resb 	1		; address
 21417 00000005 ??                       .acc_rights:	resb	1		; access rights ( CPL0 - R/W )
 21418 00000006 ????                     .reserved:	resw	1		;

 21448                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIT1.ASM)

 21451                                  ; (SYSINIT:0CA6h)
 21452                                  
 21453                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 21454                                  
 21455                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 21456                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 21457                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 21458                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 21459                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 21460                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 21461                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 21462                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 21463                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 21464                                  ;								      ;I070
 21465                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 21466                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 21467                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 21468                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 21469                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 21470                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 21471                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 21472                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 21473                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 21474                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 21475                                  ;								      ;I070
 21476                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 21477                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 21478                                  
 21479                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21480                                  	; ds = cs
 21481                                  
 21482                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 21483                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 21484                                  
 21485 00000BCC 06                      	push	es
 21486 00000BCD 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 21487 00000BCF 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 21488 00000BD1 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 21489 00000BD3 D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 21490 00000BD5 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 21491 00000BD7 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 21492 00000BD9 05[AC0B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 21493 00000BDC 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 21494                                  
 21495                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 21496                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 21497                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax

 21499                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+4],dl
 21500                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21501                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax

 21671                                  ;		   variable which has the top of free memory for

 21677                                  ;		that automatically updates alloclim every time we
 21678                                  ;		set up some new CDSs. Instead, I've added code

 21728 00000CA4 F3AA                    	rep	stosb			; zero out rest of CURDIR_TEXTs
 21729                                  
 21730                                  ;	should handle the system that does not have any floppies.
 21731                                  ;	in this case,we are going to pretended there are two dummy floppies
 21732                                  ;	in the system. still they have dpb and cds,but we are going to
 21733                                  ;	0 out curdir_flags,curdir_devptr of cds so ibmdos can issue
 21734                                  ;	"invalid drive specification" message when the user try to
 21735                                  ;	access them.
 21736                                  ;
 21737                                  ;	(ax) = 0
 21738                                  ;	(es:di) = CURDIR_FLAGS in the CDS records
 21739                                  ;	(ds:si) = Next DPB (-1 if none)
 21740

 21743                                  
 21744                                  ;	check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not go to normcds.
 21745                                  ;	if we are faking floppy drives then see if this cds being initialised
 21746                                  ;	is for drive a: or b: by checking the appropriate field in the dpb
 21747                                  ;	pointed to by ds:si. if not for a: or b: then go to normcds. if
 21748                                  ;	for a: or b: then execute the code given below starting at fooset_zero.
 21749                                  ;	for dpb offsets look at inc\dpb.inc.

 21756 00000CB1 7512                    	jne	short normcds 		; machine has floppy drives
 21757                                  	;cmp	byte [si+DPB.drive],1	; if dpb_drive = 0 (a) or 1 (b).
 21758                                  	;cmp	byte [si],1

 21762                                  					; AX should be zero here

 21764 00000CBB 59                      	pop	cx
 21765 00000CBC EB17                    	jmp	short get_next_dpb
 21766                                  
 21767                                  ;	(ax) = 0
 21768                                  
 21769                                  fooset_zero:
 21770 00000CBE B103                    	mov	cl,3
 21771 00000CC0 F3AB                    	rep	stosw

 21773 00000CC3 EB10                    	jmp	short fincds

 21775                                  ;*	We have a "normal" DPB and thus a normal CDS.
 21776                                  ;
 21777                                  ;	(ax) = 0
 21778                                  ;	(es:di) = CURDIR_FLAGS in the CDS records
 21779                                  ;	(ds:si) = Next DPB (-1 if none)

 21781                                  normcds:

 21784                                  ;	if a non-fat based media is detected (by dpb.numberoffat == 0), then
 21785                                  ;	set curdir_flags to 0. this is for signaling ibmdos and ifsfunc that
 21786                                  ;	this media is a non-fat based one.

 21792 00000CC6 384408                  	cmp	[si+8],al ; 0
 21793 00000CC9 7403                    	je	short setnormcds	; yes. set curdir_flags to 0. ax = 0 now.
 21794 00000CCB B80040                  	mov	ax,curdir_inuse ; 4000h	; else,fat system. set the flag to curdir_inuse.
 21795                                  	;mov	ax,4000h
 21796                                  setnormcds:

 21803                                  get_next_dpb:				; entry point for fake_fooset_zero
 21804                                  	; 30/12/2022

 21830                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21831                                  ;***	get_dpb_for_drive_al -- lookup the DPB for drive in al

 21833                                  ;	entry:

 21835                                  ;

 21871                                  ; to allow for the safe EXECing of "install=" programs. All memory

 22528                                  
 22529                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 22530                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 22531                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 22532                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 22533                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 22534                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 22535                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 22536                                  ;
 22537                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 22538                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 22539                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 22540                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 22541                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 22542                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 22543                                  ;
 22544                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 22545                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 22546                                  ;
 22547                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 22548                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 22549                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 22550                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 22551                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 22552                                  ;
 22553                                  ;	for round-up machine
 22554                                  ;
 22555                                  ;			  none.
 22556                                  
 22557                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 22558                                  ;
 22559                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 22560                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 22561                                  
 22562                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22563                                  
 22564 00000FE5 50                      	push	ax
 22565 00000FE6 53                      	push	bx
 22566 00000FE7 52                      	push	dx

 22573 00000FF0 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f3h,0ffh
 22574 00000FF1 42                      	inc	dx

 22608 0000101C EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f4h,0ffh
 22609 0000101D 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address

 22768                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22769                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 22770                                  ;
 22771                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 22772                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 22773                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 22774                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 22775                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed

 22791                                  ; carridge return.

 22939                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 22940                                  ;
 22941                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 22942                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 22943                                  ;
 22944                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 22945                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 22946                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 22947                                  
 22948                                  ParaRound:
 22949 0000114B 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 22950 0000114E D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 22951 00001150 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22952 00001152 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22953 00001154 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22954 00001156 C3                      	retn

 22956                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22957                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 22958                                  ;
 22959                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 22960                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 22961                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 22962                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 22963                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 22964                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 22965                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 22966                                  ;
 22967                                  ;in: after relocation,
 22968                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 22969                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 22970                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 22971                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 22972                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 22973                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 22974                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 22975                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 22976                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 22977                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 22978                                  ;
 22979                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 22980                                  
 22981                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22982                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22983                                  sysinit_base:				
 22984 00001157 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 22985 0000115C 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 22986 00001161 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 22987 00001163 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 22988 00001168 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 22989 0000116D 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 22990 0000116E 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 22991 0000116F 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 22992                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 22993                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 22994 00001171 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 22995 00001174 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 22996 00001179 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 22997                                  
 22998                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 22999                                  
 23000 0000117B B409                    	mov	ah,9
 23001 0000117D 0E                      	push	cs
 23002 0000117E 1F                      	pop	ds
 23003                                  	; 30/12/2022

 23005                                  	;mov	dx, 102
 23006 0000117F BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 23007                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 23008 00001182 CD21                    	int	21h
 23009                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 23010                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 23011                                  
 23012                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 23013                                  stall:
 23014                                  	; 24/10/2022
 23015                                  _stall: 
 23016                                  	; 11/12/2022
 23017 00001184 F4                      	hlt 
 23018                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 23019                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 23020 00001185 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 23021                                  
 23022                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 23023 00001187 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 23024                                  
 23025                                  ;-------------------------------------
 23026                                  
 23027                                  sum_up:
 23028                                  
 23029                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 23030                                  ;out:  ax - result
 23031                                  ;
 23032                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 23033                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 23034                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 23035                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 23036                                  ;
 23037                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 23038                                  
 23039 0000118C 1E                      	push	ds
 23040                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 23041                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 23042 0000118D 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 23043                                  	; 24/10/2022
 23044                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 23045 00001191 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 23046 00001193 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 23047 00001195 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 23048 00001197 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 23049                                  					; whole test better fail.
 23050 0000119C D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 23051 0000119E 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 23052                                  sum1:
 23053 000011A0 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 23054 000011A2 46                      	inc	si
 23055 000011A3 46                      	inc	si
 23056 000011A4 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 23057                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 23058                                  sum_sys_code:
 23059                                  	; 24/10/2022
 23060 000011A6 BEA611                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23061                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23062                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 23063                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 23064                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 23065                                  	; 02/11/2022
 23066                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 23067                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 23068 000011A9 B9[704D]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 23069 000011AC 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 23070 000011AE D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 23071                                  sum2:
 23072 000011B0 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 23073 000011B3 46                      	inc	si
 23074 000011B4 46                      	inc	si

 23102                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23103                                  ; Set_Buffer
 23104                                  ;
 23105                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 23106                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 23107                                  ;
 23108                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 23109                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 23110                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 23111                                  ;
 23112                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 23113                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 23114                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23115                                  
 23116                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23117                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 23118                                  
 23119                                  set_buffer:
 23120 000011D8 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 23121 000011DA E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 23122 000011DD 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 23123                                  	;mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 23124                                  	; 17/09/2023

 23248                                  
 23249                                  ; ======================================================================
 23250                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 23251                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23252                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23253                                  
 23254                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23255                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 23256                                  ;
 23257                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 23258                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 23259                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 23260                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 23261                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 23262                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 23263                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 23264                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 23265                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 23266                                  ;
 23267                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 23268                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 23269                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 23270                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 23271                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 23272                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 23273                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 23274                                  ;	conditions:
 23275                                  ;
 23276                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 23277                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 23278                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 23279                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 23280                                  ;
 23281                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 23282                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 23283                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 23284                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 23285                                  ;
 23286                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 23287                                  ;
 23288                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 23289                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 23290                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 23291                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 23292                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 23293                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 23294                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 23295                                  ;	interrupt line.
 23296                                  ;
 23297                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 23298                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 23299                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 23300                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 23301                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 23302                                  ;
 23303                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 23304                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 23305                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 23306                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 23307                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 23308                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 23309                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 23310                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 23311                                  ;
 23312                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 23313                                  
 23314                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23315                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 23316                                  
 23317                                  	; 14/12/2022
 23318                                  stackinit:
 23319 0000127F 50                      	push	ax
 23320 00001280 1E                      	push	ds
 23321 00001281 06                      	push	es
 23322 00001282 53                      	push	bx
 23323 00001283 51                      	push	cx
 23324 00001284 52                      	push	dx
 23325 00001285 57                      	push	di
 23326 00001286 56                      	push	si
 23327 00001287 55                      	push	bp
 23328                                  
 23329                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 23330                                  
 23331                                  	; 12/12/2022
 23332                                  	; ds = cs

 23334 0000128B 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*

 23336                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)

 24156                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24157                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24158                                  
 24159                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 24160                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 24161                                  
 24162                                  new_init_loop:
 24163                                  
 24164                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 24165                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 24166                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 24167                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 24168                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 24169                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 24170                                  
 24171 00001471 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 24172 00001474 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 24173 00001476 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 24174 0000147A 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 24175                                  
 24176 0000147D 1E                      	push	ds
 24177                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 24178                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 24179                                  	; 21/10/2022
 24180 0000147E B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 24181 00001481 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 24182 00001483 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 24183 00001486 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 24184 00001488 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 24185 0000148C 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 24186 0000148F 1F                      	pop	ds
 24187                                  
 24188 00001490 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 24189 00001493 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 24190 00001497 C3                      	retn
 24191                                  
 24192                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine

 24219 0000149D 2E890E[BB14]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 24220 000014A2 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 24221                                  	; 25/10/2022
 24222                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 24223 000014A4 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 24224 000014A8 41                      	inc	cx
 24225                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 24226 000014A9 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 24227                                  
 24228                                  	; 04/09/2023
 24229                                  	;pop	cx
 24230                                  	;pop	es
 24231                                  	
 24232 000014AE 2EFF06[6403]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 24233 000014B3 C3                      	retn

 24435                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24436                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 24437                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 24438                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 24439                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 24440                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 24441                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 24442                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 24443                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 24444                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 24445                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24446                                  
 24447                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 24448                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 24449 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 24450 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 24451 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 24452                                  endstruc
 24453                                  
 24454                                  _$P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 24455                                  _$P_I_Use_Default  equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 24456                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 24457                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 24458                                  
 24459                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24460                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 24461                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 24462                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 24463                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 24464                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 24465                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 24466                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 24467                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 24468                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 24469                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 24470                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24471                                  
 24472                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 24473                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 24474 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 24475 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 24476 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 24477                                  endstruc
 24478                                  
 24479                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24480                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 24481                                  ;
 24482                                  ;
 24483                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 24484                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 24485                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 24486                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 24487                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 24488                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24489                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24490                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24491                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24492                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24493                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 24494                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 24495                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 24496                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 24497                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 24498                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 24499                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 24500                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 24501                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 24502                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 24503                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 24504                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 24505                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 24506                                  ;	   :
 24507                                  ;
 24508                                  ;Note:
 24509                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 24510                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 24511                                  ;
 24512                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 24513                                  ;
 24514                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 24515                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 24516                                  ;
 24517                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 24518                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 24519                                  ;
 24520                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 24521                                  ;
 24522                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 24523                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 24524                                  ;
 24525                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 24526                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 24527                                  ;
 24528                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 24529                                  ;
 24530                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 24531                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 24532                                  ;
 24533                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 24534                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 24535                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 24536                                  ;
 24537                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 24538                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 24539                                  ;
 24540                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 24541                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 24542                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 24543                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24544                                  
 24545                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 24546                                  
 24547                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 24548                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 24549                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 24550                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 24551                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 24552                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 24553                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 24554                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 24555                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 24556                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 24557                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 24558                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 24559                                  
 24560                                  ;**** Function flags
 24561                                  
 24562                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 24563                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 24564                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 24565                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 24566                                  
 24567                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 24568                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 24569 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 24570 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 24571 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 24572 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 24573 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 24574 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 24575                                  endstruc
 24576                                  
 24577                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24578                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 24579                                  ;
 24580                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 24581                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 24582                                  ;	     +-
 24583                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 24584                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 24585                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 24586                                  ;	     |	:
 24587                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 24588                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 24589                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 24590                                  ;	     |	:
 24591                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 24592                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 24593                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 24594                                  ;	     +-	:
 24595                                  ;
 24596                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 24597                                  ;
 24598                                  ;Note:
 24599                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 24600                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 24601                                  ;
 24602                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 24603                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 24604                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 24605                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24606                                  
 24607                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 24608                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 24609                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 24610                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 24611                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 24612                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 24613                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 24614                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 24615                                  
 24616                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 24617 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 24618 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 24619 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 24620 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 24621 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 24622                                  endstruc
 24623                                  
 24624                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24625                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 24626                                  ;
 24627                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 24628                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 24629                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 24630                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 24631                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 24632                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 24633                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 24634                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 24635                                  ;
 24636                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 24637                                  ;
 24638                                  ;            +-
 24639                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 24640                                  ;	    | or
 24641                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 24642                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 24643                                  ;	    | or
 24644                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 24645                                  ;	    | or
 24646                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 24647                                  ;	    | or
 24648                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 24649                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 24650                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 24651                                  ;	    | or
 24652                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 24653                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 24654                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 24655                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 24656                                  ;	    +-
 24657                                  ;
 24658                                  ;
 24659                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 24660                                  ;      list.
 24661                                  ;
 24662                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 24663                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 24664                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 24665                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24666                                  
 24667                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 24668                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 24669 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 24670 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 24671 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 24672 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 24673                                  endstruc

 24680                                  _$P_List_Idx	   equ	2		;AN000; List Index

 24702                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 24703                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 24704                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 24790                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24791                                  ; SysParse;
 24792                                  ;
 24793                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 24794                                  ;
 24795                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 24796                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 24797                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 24798                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 24799                                  ;
 24800                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 24801                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 24802                                  ;		 is in DS.
 24803                                  ;
 24804                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 24805                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 24806                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 24807                                  ;
 24808                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 24809                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 24810                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 24811                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 24812                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 24813                                  ;
 24814                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 24815                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 24816                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 24817                                  ;
 24818                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 24819                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 24820                                  ;
 24821                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 24822                                  ;
 24823                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 24824                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 24825                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 24826                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 24827                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 24828                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 24829                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 24830                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 24831                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 24832                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 24833                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 24834                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 24835                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 24836                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 24837                                  ;	     (tm08)
 24838                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 24839                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 24840                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 24841                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 24842                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 24843                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 24844                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 24845                                  ;					  (tm12)
 24846                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 24847                                  ;					  (tm13)

 24849                                  ;					  (tm14)

 24851                                  ;					  (tm15)

 24853
