 24855                                  
 24856                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 24857                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 24858                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 24859                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 24860                                  
 24861                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 24862                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 24863                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 24864                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 24865                                  ;
 24866                                  
 24867                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 24868                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 24869                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 24870                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 24871                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 24872                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 24873                                  
 24874                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 24875                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 24876                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 24877                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 24878                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 24879                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 24880                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 24881                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 24882                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 24883                                  
 24884                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 24885                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 24886                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 24887                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 24888                                  ;	     segment.
 24889                                  
 24890                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 24891                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 24892                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 24893                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 24894                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 24895                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 24896

 25487                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25488                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 25489                                  ;
 25490                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 25491                                  ;
 25492                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 25493                                  ;	    AL = type
 25494                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 25495                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 25496                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 25497                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 25498                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 25499                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 25500                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 25501                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 25502                                  ;
 25503                                  ; Output:   None
 25504                                  ;
 25505                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 25506                                  ;
 25507                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 25508                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25509

 25520

 25524                                  					;AN000;   then set it to the result

 25726                                  ; _$P_Remove_Colon;
 25727                                  ;
 25728                                  ; Function: Remove colon at end
 25729                                  ;
 25730                                  ; Input:    cs:SI points to string buffer to be examineed
 25731                                  ;
 25732                                  ; Output:   None
 25733                                  ;
 25734                                  ; Use:	_$P_Chk_DBCS

 25736                                  
 25737                                  _$P_Remove_Colon:
 25738 000018A8 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;

 25740                                  _$P_RCOL_Loop:				;AN000;
 25741 000018AA 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 25742 000018AD 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 25743 000018AF 741A                    	jz	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; if yes, just exit
 25744                                  
 25745 000018B1 3C3A                    	cmp	al,_$P_Colon		;AN000; is it colon ?
 25746 000018B3 750D                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000;
 25747                                  
 25748 000018B5 2E807C0100              	cmp	byte [cs:si+1],_$P_NULL ;AN000; if so, next is NULL ?
 25749 000018BA 7506                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000; no, then next char
 25750

 25752 000018C0 EB09                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; and exit.
 25753                                  
 25754                                  _$P_RCOL00:				;AN000;
 25755 000018C2 E81204                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; if not colon, then check if
 25756 000018C5 7301                    	jnc	short _$P_RCOL01	;AN000; DBCS leading byte.

 25759                                  _$P_RCOL01:				;AN000;

 25762

 25765 000018CC 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;

 25809                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25810                                  ; _$P_Do_CAPS_Char;
 25811                                  ;
 25812                                  ; Function: Perform capitalization along with the file case map table
 25813                                  ;	    or character case map table.

 25904                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25905                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 25906                                  ;
 25907                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 25908                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 25909                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 25910                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 25911                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 25912                                  ;
 25913                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 25914                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 25915                                  ;
 25916                                  ; Output:    None
 25917                                  ;
 25918                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 25919                                  ;
 25920                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 25921                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25922                                  
 25923                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25924                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 25925                                  
 25926                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25927                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 25928                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 25929 0000192A 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25930 0000192B 2E800E[D114]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 25931 00001931 2E8026[D114]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 25932                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023 
 25933 00001937 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 25934 0000193A 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 25935 0000193C 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 25936                                  
 25937 0000193E 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 25938 00001940 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 25939                                  
 25940 00001942 2E800E[D114]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 25941                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 25942 00001948 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 25943                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 25944 00001949 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 25945 0000194C 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25946 0000194D C3                      	retn

 26244                                  ;

 26246                                  ;

 26248                                  ;	     CY = 0 : AL contains binary value

 26255                                  	;jb	short _$P_0099Err	;AN000; must be 0 =< al =< 9

 26258

 26260                                  	ja	short _$P_0099Err	;AN000; must be 0 =< al =< 9

 26263                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26264                                  	; cf=0

 26266                                  	retn				;AN000;
 26267

 26269                                  	stc				;AN000; indicate error

 26542                                  ; Function:  Check if the input string is valid file spec format.
 26543                                  ;	     And set the result buffer.
 26544                                  ;
 26545                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 26546                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 26547                                  ;
 26548                                  ; Output:    None

 26551                                  ;

 26859                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 26860                                  ;
 26861                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 26862                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 26863                                  ;	    blanks.
 26864                                  ;
 26865                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26866                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 26867                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List

 26870                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 26871                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 26872                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26873                                  
 26874                                  	; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26875                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FAEh
 26876                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2451h) ; (Retro DOS v5.0)
 26877                                  
 26878                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 26879 00001C70 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 26880 00001C71 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;

 26882                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 26883                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 26884 00001C78 2E8026[D114]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;

 26886 00001C80 7423                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26887                                  
 26888 00001C82 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 26889 00001C84 741F                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26890                                  
 26891 00001C86 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 26892 00001C88 741E                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 26893                                  
 26894                                  ; Note: _$P_Chk_Delim00 part of code is nonsense here
 26895                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 26896                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26897                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 26898                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:246Bh)
 26899                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FC8h)
 26900                                  %if 0
 26901                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26902                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 26903                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 26904                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26905                                  
 26906                                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 26907                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26908                                  
 26909                                  	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 26910                                  	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 26911                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 26912                                  	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26913                                  %endif
 26914                                  
 26915                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;

 26936 00001CA2 E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 26937                                  
 26938                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 26939                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 26940                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26941                                  	; cx=0 here
 26942 00001CA4 41                      	inc	cx ; cx=1, zf=0
 26943                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 26944                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 26945 00001CA5 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26946 00001CA6 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 26947 00001CA7 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 26948                                  
 26949                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 26950 00001CA8 2EA2[CB14]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 26951 00001CAC 2EF606[D114]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 26952 00001CB2 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 26953                                  
 26954 00001CB4 2E800E[D114]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 26955                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 26956                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 26957 00001CBA 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 26958 00001CBC EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26959                                  
 26960                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26961                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 26962                                  ;
 26963                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 26964                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 26965                                  ;
 26966                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26967                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 26968                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 26969                                  ;
 26970                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 26971                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 26972                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 26973                                  
 26974                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 26975                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 26976                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 26977                                  ;
 26978                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 26979                                  
 26980                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 26981                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26982                                  
 26983                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 26984                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 26985                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 26986                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26987 00001CBE BD[DA14]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 26988                                  
 26989                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 26990 00001CC1 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 26991 00001CC3 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 26992                                  
 26993                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 26994 00001CC5 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26995 00001CC7 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 26996                                  
 26997 00001CC9 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 26998                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26999                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27000 00001CCA C3                      	retn
 27001                                  
 27002                                  ; 12/12/2022
 27003                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 27004                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 27005                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 27006                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 27007                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 27008                                  
 27009                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 27010                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 27011 00001CCB 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 27012 00001CCD 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 27013                                  
 27014 00001CCF 2E800E[D114]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 27015                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 27016                                  
 27017                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27018                                  	; cf=0
 27019                                  	;retn
 27020                                  
 27021                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 27022                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27023                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 27024 00001CD5 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 27025                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 27026                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 27027 00001CD6 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 27028                                  
 27029                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27030                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 27031                                  ;
 27032                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 27033                                  ;
 27034                                  ;  Input:
 27035                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 27036                                  ;
 27037                                  ;  Output:
 27038                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 27039                                  ;
 27040                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 27041                                  ;
 27042                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 27043                                  ;***************************************************************************
 27044                                  
 27045                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 27046 00001CD7 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 27047 00001CD8 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 27048 00001CD9 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 27049                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 27050                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 27051                                  	; 08/07/2023
 27052 00001CDA 2E8B36[CE14]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 27053 00001CDF 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 27054 00001CE1 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 27055 00001CE3 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 27056 00001CE4 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 27057 00001CE5 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 27058 00001CE6 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 27059 00001CE7 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 27060 00001CE8 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 27061 00001CE9 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 27062                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 27063                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 27064 00001CEA 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 27065 00001CEC B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 27066 00001CEF CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 27067                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 27068 00001CF1 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 27069 00001CF3 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 27070 00001CF5 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 27071 00001CF6 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 27072 00001CF7 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 27073 00001CF8 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 27074 00001CF9 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 27075 00001CFA 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 27076 00001CFB 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 27077 00001CFC 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 27078                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 27079 00001CFE 2E8936[CC14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 27080 00001D03 2E891E[CE14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 27081                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 27082                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 27083                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 27084                                  	; 08/07/2023
 27085 00001D08 2EC536[CC14]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 27086                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 27087 00001D0D 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 27088 00001D10 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 27089 00001D12 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 27090 00001D14 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 27091 00001D16 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 27092 00001D19 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 27093 00001D1B F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 27094 00001D1C EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 27095                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 27096 00001D1E 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 27097 00001D1F 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 27098                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 27099 00001D20 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 27100                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 27101                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27102                                  	; cf=0
 27103                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 27104                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 27105 00001D22 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 27106 00001D23 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 27107 00001D24 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 27108 00001D25 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 27670                                  
 27671                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 27672                                  
 27673                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27674                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27675                                  
 27676                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 27677                                  ;
 27678                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 27679                                  ;
 27680                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27681                                  ;
 27682                                  ;   Modification log:
 27683                                  ;
 27684                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 27685                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 27686                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 27687                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 27688                                  ;
 27689                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27690                                  ;
 27691                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 27692                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 27693                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 27694                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 27695                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 27696                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 27697                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 27698                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 27699                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 27700                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 27701                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 27702                                  ;
 27703                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27704                                  
 27705                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 27706                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 27707                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 27708                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 27709                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 27710                                  
 27711                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 27712                                  
 27713                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 27714                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 27715                                  
 27716                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 27717                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 27718                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 27719                                  
 27720                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 27721                                  ;
 27722                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 27723                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 27724                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 27725                                  ;	           line.
 27726                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 27727                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 27728                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 27729                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 27730                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 27731                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 27732                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 27733                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 27734                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 27735                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 27736                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 27737                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 27738                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 27739                                  ;	           for details).
 27740                                  
 27741 00001F25 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 27742 00001F26 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 27743 00001F27 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 27744 00001F29 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 27745 00001F2A 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 27746 00001F3A 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 27747 00001F5A 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 27748 00001F5B 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 27749 00001F5C 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 27750                                  
 27751                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 27752                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 27753                                  
 27754                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 27755                                  
 27756                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27757                                  
 27758                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 27759

 27762                                  
 27763                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27764                                  ; (SYSINIT:212Bh)	
 27765

 27767                                  
 27768 00001F5D 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 27769 00001F5F 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 27770 00001F61 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 27771 00001F63 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 27772 00001F67 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver

 27813                                  ;
 27814                                  ; procedure : doconf
 27815                                  ;
 27816                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 27817                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .
 27818                                  ;

 27820                                  
 27821                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27822                                  doconf:
 27823 00001F91 0E                      	push	cs
 27824 00001F92 1F                      	pop	ds
 27825                                  
 27826 00001F93 B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 27827                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 27828 00001F96 CD21                    	int	21h
 27829 00001F98 8816[3A46]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 27830                                  
 27831                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21  IO.SYS)
 27832                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27833                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27834                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 27835 00001F9C 8816[3846]              	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 27836                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 27837                                  
 27838 00001FA0 BA[4F45]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ;now pointing to file description
 27839 00001FA3 B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 27840                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		;open file "config.sys"
 27841 00001FA6 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 27842 00001FA7 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 27843 00001FA9 7309                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 27844                                  
 27845                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27846                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27847                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG

 28064 00002077 50                              push    ax                      ;
 28065 00002078 E8B121                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 28066 0000207B 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 28067 0000207D E8AC21                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 28068 00002080 86C4                            xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next

 28070 00002085 58                              pop     ax
 28071                                  ;
 28072                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 28073                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 28074                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 28075                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 28076                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 28077                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 28078                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 28079                                  ;   spot.
 28080                                  ;
 28081                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 28082                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 28083                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 28084                                  ;   retrieved.
 28085                                  ;
 28086 00002086 803E[CD02]02                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?

 28281                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28282                                  ; buffer command
 28283                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28284                                  
 28285                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28286                                  ;									      *
 28287                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 28288                                  ;									      *
 28289                                  ; input :								      *
 28290                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 28291                                  ; output:								      *
 28292                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 28293                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 28294                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 28295                                  ;									      *
 28296                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 28297                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 28298                                  ; logic:								      *
 28299                                  ; {									      *
 28300                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 28301                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 28302                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 28303                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 28304                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 28305                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 28306                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 28307                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 28308                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 28309                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *

 30020                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30021                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 30022                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 30023                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 30024                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 30025                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 30026                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 30027                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 30028                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30029                                  
 30030                                  ;**************************************************************************
 30031                                  ;									  *
 30032                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 30033                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 30034                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 30035                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 30036                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 30037                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 30038                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 30039                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 30040                                  ; input :								  *
 30041                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 30042                                  ; output:								  *
 30043                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 30044                                  ;									  *
 30045                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 30046                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 30047                                  ; logic:								  *
 30048                                  ; {									  *
 30049                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 30050                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 30051                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 30052                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 30053                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 30054                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 30055                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 30056                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 30057                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 30058                                  ;	     }								  *
 30059                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 30060                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 30061                                  ;	};								  *
 30062                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 30063                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 30064                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 30065                                  ; };									  *
 30066                                  ;**************************************************************************

 30816                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 30823                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 30824                                  ;	*** after each call.
 30825                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 30826                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 30827                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 30828                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 30829                                  ;	 procedure.

 30833                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand

 31179                                  ;
 31180                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 31181                                  ;
 31182                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 31183                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 31184                                  ;
 31185                                  ;	Output : none
 31186                                  ;
 31187                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 31188                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 31189                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 31190                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 31191                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 31192                                  ;
 31193                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31194                                  
 31195                                  LieInt12Mem:
 31196                                  	; 11/12/2022
 31197                                  	; ds = cs
 31198 00002989 A1[A502]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 31199                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 31200                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 31201 0000298C E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 31202 0000298F 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 31203                                  	; 13/05/2019
 31204                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 31205                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 31206                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 31207                                  	; 11/12/2022
 31208                                  	; ds = cs
 31209 00002991 803E[7B1F]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 31210 00002996 74F0                    	je	short limx
 31211 00002998 A1[611F]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 31212                                  lim_set:
 31213                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 31214                                  	; 11/12/2022
 31215                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 31216                                  ;limx:
 31217                                  	;retn
 31218                                  	
 31219                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 31220                                  
 31221                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31222                                  ;
 31223                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 31224                                  ;
 31225                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 31226                                  ;	Output : none
 31227                                  ;
 31228                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 31229                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 31230                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 31231                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 31232                                  ;
 31233                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31234                                  
 31235                                  	; 01/11/2022
 31236                                  SetInt12Mem:
 31237 0000299B 1E                      	push	ds
 31238 0000299C BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 31239 0000299F 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 31240 000029A1 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 31241 000029A5 2E891E[7F1F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 31242 000029AA B106                    	mov	cl,6
 31243 000029AC D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks

 31247                                  ;limx:

 31335                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 31336                                  ;%if 0
 31337                                  
 31338                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31339                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 31340                                  
 31341                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 31342                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 31343                                  
 31344                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 31345                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 31346                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 31347                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31348                                  
 31349                                  ;******************************************************************************
 31350                                  ;
 31351                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 31352                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 31353                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 31354                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 31355                                  ;
 31356                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 31357                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 31358                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 31359                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 31360                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 31361                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 31362                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 31363                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 31364                                  ; available during the load.
 31365                                  ;
 31366                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 31367                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 31368                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 31369                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 31370                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 31371                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 31372                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 31373                                  ;
 31374                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 31375                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 31376                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 31377                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 31378                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 31379                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 31380                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 31381                                  ;
 31382                                  ;******************************************************************************
 31383                                  
 31384                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 31385                                  
 31386                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 31387                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 31388                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 31389                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 31390                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 31391                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 31392                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 31393                                  
 31394                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 31395                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 31396                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 31397                                  
 31398                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31399                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 31400                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31401                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 31402                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 31403                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 31404                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31405                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31406                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 31407                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 31408                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31409                                  
 31410                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31411                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 31412                                  
 31413                                  InitVar:
 31414                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31415                                  	; ds = cs
 31416                                  
 31417                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 31418                                  	; 03/01/2023
 31419                                  	;push	ax
 31420                                  	;push	cx
 31421                                  	;push	di
 31422 000029FD 06                      	push	es
 31423                                  
 31424                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 31425 000029FE 0E                      	push	cs
 31426 000029FF 07                      	pop	es
 31427                                  
 31428 00002A00 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 31429                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 31430                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 31431                                  	;mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 31432                                  	;mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 31433                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 31434                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 31435                                  
 31436                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31437                                  	; ds = cs
 31438 00002A02 A2[261F]                	mov	[fUmbTiny],al		;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 31439 00002A05 A2[251F]                	mov	[fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 31440 00002A08 A3[271F]                	mov	[SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 31441 00002A0B C606[291F]FF            	mov	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 31442                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 31443 00002A10 A2[5C1F]                	mov	[fm_argc], al		;Start with zero args having been read
 31444

 31448 00002A17 BF[2A1F]                	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 31449 00002A1A F3AA                    	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 31450

 31452                                  	; 01/01/2033

 31454 00002A1E BF[3A1F]                	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 31455 00002A21 F3AB                    	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 31456

 31458
