 31460 00002A23 07                      	pop	es
 31461                                  	; 03/01/2023
 31462                                  	;pop	di
 31463                                  	;pop	cx
 31464                                  	;pop	ax	 	
 31465                                  
 31466 00002A24 C3                      	retn
 31467                                  
 31468                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31469                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 31470                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31471                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 31472                                  ; EXIT    : None
 31473                                  ; ERROR   : None
 31474                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 31475                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31476                                  
 31477                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31478                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 31479                                  FixMem:
 31480                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31481                                  	;push	ax
 31482                                  	;push	bx
 31483                                  	;push	cx
 31484                                  	;push	dx
 31485 00002A25 06                      	push	es
 31486                                  
 31487 00002A26 E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 31488                                  
 31489 00002A29 E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 31490 00002A2C 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 31491                                  
 31492 00002A2E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 31493                                  
 31494                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 31495                                  
 31496 00002A30 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 31497 00002A32 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 31498 00002A34 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 31499                                  
 31500                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31501                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 31502                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 31503                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31504                                  
 31505 00002A35 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 31506 00002A39 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 31507 00002A3E 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 31508 00002A40 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 31509                                  
 31510                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 31511                                  
 31512 00002A42 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 31513 00002A47 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 31514 00002A49 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 31515                                  
 31516 00002A4D 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 31517                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 31518                                  	; 11/07/2023
 31519 00002A52 43                      	inc	bx
 31520 00002A53 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 31521                                  
 31522                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 31523                                  
 31524 00002A58 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 31525 00002A5A 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 31526                                  
 31527 00002A5F 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 31528 00002A61 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31529 00002A66 43                      	inc	bx
 31530 00002A67 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 31531                                  
 31532                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 31533 00002A69 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 31534 00002A6B 75C8                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 31535                                  fmX:	
 31536 00002A6D E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 31537                                  
 31538 00002A70 07                      	pop	es
 31539                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31540                                  	;pop	dx
 31541                                  	;pop	cx
 31542                                  	;pop	bx
 31543                                  	;pop	ax
 31544                                  
 31545 00002A71 C3                      	retn
 31546                                  
 31547                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31548                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 31549                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31550                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 31551                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 31552                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31553                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 31554                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31555                                  
 31556                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31557                                  fm_link:
 31558 00002A72 B80258                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 31559 00002A75 CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 31560                                  
 31561                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 31562                                  	;
 31563                                  	;push	es
 31564                                  	;push	cs
 31565                                  	;pop	es
 31566                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 31567                                  	;pop	es
 31568                                  	
 31569                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31570                                  	; ds = cs
 31571                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 31572 00002A77 A2[5A1F]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 31573                                  
 31574 00002A7A B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 31575 00002A7D BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 31576 00002A80 CD21                    	int	21h
 31577 00002A82 C3                      	retn
 31578                                  
 31579                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31580                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 31581                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31582                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 31583                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31584                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31585                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 31586                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31587                                  
 31588                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31589                                  fm_unlink:
 31590 00002A83 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 31591                                  	
 31592                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 31593                                  	;
 31594                                  	;push	ds
 31595                                  	;push	cs
 31596                                  	;pop	ds
 31597                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 31598                                  	;pop	ds
 31599                                  	
 31600                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31601                                  	; ds = cs
 31602                                  	;mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 31603 00002A85 8A1E[5A1F]              	mov	bl,[fm_umb]
 31604                                  
 31605 00002A89 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 31606 00002A8C CD21                    	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 31607 00002A8E C3                      	retn
 31608                                  
 31609                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31610                                  
 31611                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31612                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 31613                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 31614                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31615                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 31616                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 31617                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 31618                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31619                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31620                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 31621                                  ;
 31622                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 31623                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 31624                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 31625                                  ;
 31626                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 31627                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 31628                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 31629                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 31630                                  ;
 31631                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 31632                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 31633                                  ;
 31634                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31635                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 31636                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 31637                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 31638                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 31639                                  ;     lh
 31640                                  ;     /l
 31641                                  ;     1
 31642                                  ;     1000
 31643                                  ;     2
 31644                                  ;     print
 31645                                  ;     /d
 31646                                  ;     :lpt2
 31647                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 31648                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 31649                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 31650                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 31651                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 31652                                  ; for:
 31653                                  ;    Each /L
 31654                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 31655                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 31656                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 31657                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 31658                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 31659                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31660                                  
 31661                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31662                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 31663                                  
 31664                                  ParseVar:
 31665                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 31666                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31667                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 31668 00002A8F 1E                      	push	ds
 31669 00002A90 06                      	push	es
 31670                                  
 31671 00002A91 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 31672 00002A92 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 31673 00002A93 FC                      	cld
 31674                                  
 31675                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31676                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 31677                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31678                                  
 31679 00002A94 AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 31680 00002A95 E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 31681 00002A98 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 31682                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31683 00002A9A 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 31684 00002A9C 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 31685                                  
 31686 00002A9E 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 31687 00002A9F F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 31688 00002AA0 EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 31689                                  
 31690 00002AA2 AC                      pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 31691                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 31692 00002AA3 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 31693                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 31694 00002AA5 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 31695 00002AA7 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 31696                                  
 31697                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 31698 00002AA9 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 31699                                  
 31700                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 31701                                  	;
 31702                                  	;push	es
 31703                                  	;push	cs
 31704                                  	;pop	es
 31705                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 31706                                  	;pop	es
 31707                                  
 31708 00002AAE 2EC606[261F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 31709                                  
 31710 00002AB4 EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 31711                                  
 31712                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 31713 00002AB6 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 31714 00002AB8 750D                    	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 31715                                  
 31716                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 31717 00002ABA 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 31718                                  
 31719 00002ABF E80E00                  	call	parseL
 31720 00002AC2 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 31721                                  
 31722 00002AC4 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 31723 00002AC5 EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 31724

 31726 00002AC7 B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 31727 00002ACA 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 31728 00002ACB 4E                      	dec	si
 31729 00002ACC F9                      	stc
 31730                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 31731 00002ACD 07                      	pop	es
 31732 00002ACE 1F                      	pop	ds
 31733                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31734                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 31735 00002ACF C3                      	retn

 31737                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31738                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 31739                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31740                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 31741                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 31742                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 31743                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 31744                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31745                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 31746                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 31747                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 31748                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 31749                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31750                                  
 31751                                  parseL:
 31752 00002AD0 AC                      	lodsb
 31753 00002AD1 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 31754 00002AD3 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 31755                                  
 31756                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31757                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 31758                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31759                                  
 31760 00002AD5 E8DB00                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 31761 00002AD8 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 31762 00002ADA E89D01                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 31763                                  
 31764 00002ADD 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 31765 00002ADF E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 31766 00002AE2 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 31767                                  
 31768                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 31769 00002AE4 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31770                                  
 31771 00002AE9 AC                      	lodsb
 31772 00002AEA 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 31773 00002AEC 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 31774                                  
 31775 00002AEE E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 31776 00002AF1 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 31777                                  
 31778 00002AF3 E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 31779 00002AF6 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31780                                  
 31781                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31782 00002AF8 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 31783 00002AFA 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 31784                                  
 31785 00002AFC 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 31786 00002AFE 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 31787                                  
 31788                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 31789                                  
 31790 00002B00 E8B000                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 31791 00002B03 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 31792                                  
 31793 00002B05 E81601                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 31794                                  
 31795 00002B08 E8CE01                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 31796                                  
 31797                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 31798 00002B0B 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31799                                  
 31800 00002B10 AC                      	lodsb
 31801 00002B11 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 31802 00002B13 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 31803                                  
 31804 00002B15 E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 31805 00002B18 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 31806                                  
 31807 00002B1A E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 31808 00002B1D 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31809                                  
 31810                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31811 00002B1F 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 31812 00002B21 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 31813                                  plE1:	
 31814                                  	;mov	ax,1
 31815 00002B23 B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 31816 00002B26 4E                      	dec	si
 31817 00002B27 F9                      	stc
 31818 00002B28 C3                      	retn
 31819

 31859                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31860                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31861                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31862                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31863                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31864                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31865                                  ; USES:     ZF
 31866                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31867                                  
 31868                                  isEOL:

 31870 00002B31 7406                    	je	short ieX
 31871 00002B33 3C0D                    	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 31872 00002B35 7402                    	je	short ieX
 31873 00002B37 3C0A                    	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 31874                                  ieX:	
 31875 00002B39 C3                      	retn
 31876                                  
 31877                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 31879                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31880                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31881                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 31882                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31883                                  ; USES:     ZF

 31890 00002B40 7402                    	je	short iwX

 31892                                  iwX:	
 31893 00002B44 C3                      	retn

 31946                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31947                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 31948                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 31949                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 31950                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 31951                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31952                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 31953                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31954                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 31955                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31956                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31957                                  
 31958                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31959                                  stowUMB:
 31960 00002B58 3C10                    	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 31961 00002B5A 7202                    	jb	short su10
 31962 00002B5C F9                      	stc
 31963 00002B5D C3                      	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 31964                                  su10:	
 31965                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31966                                  	;push	bx

 31969                                  	;push	ds
 31970                                  	;push	es
 31971                                  	;push	cs
 31972                                  	;pop	es
 31973                                  	;push	cs
 31974                                  	;pop	ds
 31975                                  
 31976                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31977                                  	; ds <> cs
 31978                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],0FFh
 31979 00002B5E 2E803E[291F]FF          	cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED
 31980                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
 31981 00002B64 7504                    	jne	short su20
 31982 00002B66 2EA2[291F]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 31983                                  
 31984                                  	;;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 31985                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 31986                                  	;jne	short su20
 31987                                  	;mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 31988                                  su20:

 32059                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32060                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 32061                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 32062                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 32063                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 32064                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32065                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 32066                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 32067                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 32068                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 32069                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32070                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 32071                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 32072                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 32073                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32074                                  
 32075                                  gnradix:
 32076 00002B7D 0000                    	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 32077                                  
 32078                                  toDigit:
 32079 00002B7F 2E833E[7D2B]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 32080 00002B85 751C                    	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 32081                                  
 32082                                  toDigit_hex:
 32083 00002B87 80F961                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 32084 00002B8A 7209                    	jb	short td10
 32085 00002B8C 80F966                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 32086 00002B8F 7720                    	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 32087 00002B91 80E957                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 32088                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 32089 00002B94 C3                      	retn
 32090                                  td10:	
 32091 00002B95 80F941                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 32092 00002B98 7209                    	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 32093 00002B9A 80F946                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 32094 00002B9D 7712                    	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 32095 00002B9F 80E937                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 32096                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 32097 00002BA2 C3                      	retn
 32098                                  toDigit_dec:
 32099                                  td20:	
 32100 00002BA3 80F930                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 32101                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 32102 00002BA6 720A                    	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 32103 00002BA8 80F939                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 32104 00002BAB 7704                    	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 32105 00002BAD 80E930                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 32106                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 32107 00002BB0 C3                      	retn
 32108                                  tdE:	
 32109 00002BB1 F9                      	stc
 32110                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 32111 00002BB2 C3                      	retn
 32112                                  
 32113                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32114                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 32115                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32116                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 32117                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 32118                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 32119                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 32120                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32121                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 32122                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 32123                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 32124                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32125                                  
 32126                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32127                                  
 32128                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 32129                                  ; (SYSINIT:3109h)
 32130                                  
 32131                                  GetXNum:
 32132                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 32133                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32134                                  	;push	bx
 32135 00002BB3 51                      	push	cx ; *
 32136                                  	;push	ds
 32137                                  
 32138 00002BB4 FC                      	cld
 32139 00002BB5 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 32140 00002BB7 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 32141 00002BB9 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 32142 00002BBB 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 32143                                  
 32144 00002BBD 2EC706[7D2B]0A00        	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 32145                                  
 32146 00002BC4 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 32147                                  	;call	toDigit
 32148 00002BC7 E8D9FF                  	call	toDigit_dec
 32149                                  	;jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 32150                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32151 00002BCA 7233                    	jc	short gxnX
 32152                                  
 32153 00002BCC 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 32154 00002BCE 7517                    	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 32155 00002BD0 268A4C01                	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 32156 00002BD4 80F978                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 32157 00002BD7 7405                    	je	short gxn10
 32158 00002BD9 80F958                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 32159 00002BDC 7509                    	jne	short gxn20
 32160                                  
 32161                                  gxn10:	
 32162 00002BDE 2EC706[7D2B]1000        	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 32163 00002BE5 46                      	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 32164 00002BE6 46                      	inc	si
 32165                                  
 32166                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 32167                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 32168                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 32169                                  ;        BX    = 0
 32170                                  ;        CH    = 0
 32171                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 32172                                  
 32173                                  gxn20:	
 32174 00002BE7 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 32175 00002BEA 46                      	inc	si
 32176                                  
 32177 00002BEB E891FF                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 32178 00002BEE 720D                    	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 32179                                  
 32180 00002BF0 E80E00                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 32181 00002BF3 720A                    	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 32182                                  
 32183 00002BF5 01C8                    	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 32184 00002BF7 11DA                    	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 iff last add wrapped
 32185                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 32186                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 32187 00002BF9 73EC                    	jnc	short gxn20
 32188                                  gxnE:	
 32189                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 32190 00002BFB EB02                    	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 32191                                  gxnQ:	
 32192 00002BFD 4E                      	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 32193 00002BFE F8                      	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 32194                                  gxnX:	
 32195                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32196                                  	;pop	ds
 32197 00002BFF 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 32198                                  	;pop	bx
 32199 00002C00 C3                      	retn
 32200                                  
 32201                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32202                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 32203                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32204                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 32205                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 32206                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 32207                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 32208                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32209                                  
 32210                                  mul32:
 32211 00002C01 50                      	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 32212 00002C02 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 32213 00002C04 2EF726[7D2B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 32214 00002C09 7211                    	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 32215                                  
 32216 00002C0B 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 32217 00002C0D 58                      	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 32218                                  
 32219 00002C0E 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 32220 00002C10 2EF726[7D2B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 32221 00002C15 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 32222 00002C17 01DA                    	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 32223 00002C19 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 32224 00002C1B C3                      	retn
 32225                                  m32E:	
 32226 00002C1C 58                      	pop	ax
 32227 00002C1D C3                      	retn

 32229                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32230                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 32231                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32232                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 32233                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 32234                                  ; ERROR:   None
 32235                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 32236                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32237                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 32238                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 32239                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 32241                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 32242                                  toPara:
 32243 00002C1E 51                      	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 32244

 32246 00002C21 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 32247 00002C23 92                      	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 32248 00002C24 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 32249 00002C26 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 32250 00002C28 09D0                    	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll

 32255                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32256                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 32257                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32258                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 32259                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 32260                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 32261                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 32262                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32263                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 32264                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 32265                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 32266                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 32267                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32268                                  
 32269                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 32270                                  UmbHead:
 32271                                  	; 13/05/2019 (because of callers, pushs & pops are not needed here)
 32272                                  
 32273                                  	;push	si ; ?
 32274                                  	;push	ds ; ? 
 32275                                  	;push	es
 32276                                  	;push	bx ; *	
 32277                                  
 32278                                  	; 09/04/2019

 32280

 32282 00002C2E CD21                    	int	21h
 32283                                  
 32284 00002C30 26A18C00                	mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 32285                                  	
 32286                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32287 00002C34 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 32288 00002C37 F5                      	cmc
 32289                                  	; if AX=0FFFFh -> CF=1
 32290 00002C38 C3                      	retn

 32330 00002C3F 7507                    	jne	short ismX 
 32331                                  ism10:

 32341                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32342                                  ;*** AddrToUmb - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB number
 32343                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32344                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a segment address
 32345                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain the UMB number which contains the address (0==conv)
 32346                                  ; ERROR:  If the address is above UM Range, AX will return as FFFF.
 32347                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 32348                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32349                                  ; An address in the following areas is treated as:
 32350                                  ;    0      <-> umbhead (0x9FFF)          = Conventional memory
 32351                                  ;    0x9FFF <-> addr of first UM sys MCB  = UMB #1
 32352                                  ;      ...
 32353                                  ;    addr of last UM sys MCB <-> TOM      = invalid; returns #0xFFFF
 32354                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32355                                  
 32356                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 32357                                  AddrToUmb:
 32358                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32359                                  	;push	cx
 32360                                  	;push	dx
 32361 00002C49 06                      	push	es
 32362                                  
 32363 00002C4A 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX = address to search for
 32364                                  
 32365 00002C4C E8DDFF                  	call	UmbHead		; AX = first segment
 32366 00002C4F 7222                    	jc	short atuE	; If it couldn't get it, error out.
 32367                                  
 32368                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32369                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *	; ES = first UMB segment
 32370 00002C51 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now... (cx = UMB#)
 32371                                  
 32372                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32373                                  atu10:
 32374 00002C53 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; * ; ** ; 22/07/2023
 32375                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 32376                                  ; ATU10--ES - Current MCB address
 32377                                  ;        DX - Address given for conversion
 32378                                  ;        CX - Current UMB #
 32379                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 32380                                  
 32381                                  ;atu10:	
 32382                                  	;mov	ax,es ; * ; 18/07/2023
 32383 00002C55 39D0                            cmp	ax,dx		; Present segment >= given segment?
 32384 00002C57 731D                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep--done.
 32385                                  
 32386 00002C59 E8DDFF                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if this is a system MCB
 32387 00002C5C 7501                    	jnz	short atu20
 32388                                  
 32389 00002C5E 41                      	inc	cx		; If it _was_ a system MCB, we're in a new UMB.
 32390                                  atu20:	
 32391                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 32392                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end  ; 'Z'
 32393                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32394                                  	; ax = es
 32395                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 32396 00002C5F 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 32397 00002C64 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end
 32398 00002C6A 7403                    	je	short atu30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 32399                                  
 32400                                  	;NextMCB es,ax
 32401                                  
 32402                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 32403                                  	;;add	ax,[es:3]
 32404                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 32405 00002C6C 40                      	inc	ax
 32406                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32407                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *
 32408 00002C6D EBE4                    	jmp	short atu10
 32409                                  
 32410                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32411                                  ; if we get to atu30, they specified a number that was past the last MCB.
 32412                                  ; make sure it's not _inside_ that MCB before we return an error condition.
 32413                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32414                                  
 32415                                  atu30:	
 32416                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32417                                  	; ax = es + [es:ARENA.SIZE] 
 32418                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 32419                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE] ; **
 32420 00002C6F 39D0                    	cmp	ax,dx		; Present >= given?
 32421 00002C71 7303                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep! It _was_ inside.
 32422                                  atuE:	
 32423 00002C73 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Else, fall through with UMB # == -1
 32424 00002C75 49                      	dec	cx		; (that makes it return 0xFFFF and sets CF)
 32425                                  atuX:	
 32426 00002C76 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx		; Return the UMB number in AX
 32427                                  	
 32428 00002C78 07                      	pop	es	
 32429                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32430                                  	;pop	dx
 32431                                  	;pop	cx
 32432 00002C79 C3                      	retn
 32433                                  
 32434                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32435                                  ;*** convUMB - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 32436                                  ;            -- if GetXNum read a hex number, we interperete that as a segment
 32437                                  ; address rather than a UMB number... and use that address to look up a UMB.
 32438                                  ; This routine checks for that condition and calls AddrToUmb if necessary.
 32439                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32440                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a UMB number or segment, gnradix has been set by GetXNum
 32441                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain a UMB number
 32442                                  ; ERROR:  None
 32443                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 32444                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32445                                  
 32446                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 32447                                  convUMB:
 32448 00002C7A 2E833E[7D2B]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 32449 00002C80 7507                    	jne	short cu10	; If it didn't read in hex, it's not an address
 32450 00002C82 E8C4FF                  	call	AddrToUmb	; Else, convert the address to a UMB number
 32451                                  	;cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 32452                                  	;jne	short cu10
 32453                                  	;inc	ax		; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 32454                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32455 00002C85 40                      	inc	ax
 32456 00002C86 7401                    	jz	short cu10	; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 32457 00002C88 48                      	dec	ax
 32458                                  cu10:	
 32459 00002C89 C3                      	retn

 32489                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32490                                  ;*** loadLow - returns AL==0 if UMB0 == 0, else AL==1
 32491                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32492                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 32493                                  ; EXIT:   AL==0 if mem strategy should be set to LOW_FIRST, else AL==1
 32494                                  ;         Carry set if UMB0 not specified (_NOT_ an error)
 32495                                  ; ERROR:  None
 32496                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 32497                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32498                                  ; We want to set the memory strategy to LOW_FIRST if the user specified a
 32499                                  ; load UMB, and it is 0. That 0 can be either from the user having _specified_
 32500                                  ; zero (/L:0;...), or from having specified a too-big min size (/L:1,99999999)
 32501                                  ; such that the load UMB is too small, and shouldn't be used.
 32502                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 32512                                  	jne	short ll10
 32513

 32517                                  	;stc
 32518                                  	;jmp	short llX
 32519                                  	retn
 32520                                  ll10:

 32522                                  	;jz	short llX	; Yep... CF==0 (from OR) && AL=0, so just exit
 32523                                  
 32524                                  	jnz	short ll15	; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 32525                                  	retn
 32526                                  
 32527                                  	;mov	al,1
 32528                                  	;clc
 32529                                  ;llX:
 32530                                  	;pop	ds		; Return DS to where it was
 32531                                  	;retn
 32532

 32684                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 32686                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 32688                                  ; EXIT:   AX == UMB minimum size, as specified by the user

 32968 00002D28 26C7060C00454E          	mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME+4], 'EN' ; 4E45h

 32996                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32997                                  ;*** findUMB - makes ES:0 point to the first MCB in UMB given as AL
 32998                                  ;            -- returns UmbHEAD pointer (0x9FFF) if passed AL==0
 32999                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33000                                  ; ENTRY:    AL should be to a valid UMB number
 33001                                  ; EXIT:     ES:0 points to first MCB in UMB (_not_ the 8+SC MCB that heads it)
 33002                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if couldn't reach UMB (too high)
 33003                                  ; USES:     Flags, ES
 33004                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33005                                  
 33006                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 33007                                  	; (SYSINIT:3344h)
 33008                                  findUMB:
 33009                                  	; 01/01/2023
 33010                                  	;push	ax
 33011                                  	; 02/01/2023
 33012 00002D52 51                      	push	cx ; *
 33013                                  	;push	dx
 33014                                  
 33015 00002D53 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah		; Zap ah, so al==ax
 33016                                  
 33017 00002D55 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; Store the to-be-found UMB number in DX
 33018                                  
 33019 00002D57 E8D2FE                  	call	UmbHead		; Returns first UMB segment in AX
 33020                                  	; 22/07/2023
 33021                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *
 33022 00002D5A 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx		; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now...
 33023                                  
 33024                                  	; 22/07/2023
 33025                                  fu10:
 33026 00002D5C 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; * ; **
 33027                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 33028                                  ; FU10--CX - This UMB number; 0 == conventional
 33029                                  ;       DX - The UMB number they're looking for
 33030                                  ;       ES - The current MCB address
 33031                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 33032                                  
 33033                                  ;fu10:	
 33034 00002D5E 39D1                    	cmp	cx,dx		; If CX==DX, we've found the UMB we're
 33035 00002D60 7417                    	je	short fuX	; searching for--so exit.
 33036                                  
 33037 00002D62 E8D4FE                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if owner is SYSTEM
 33038 00002D65 7501                    	jnz	short fu20
 33039                                  
 33040 00002D67 41                      	inc	cx		; If it _was_ SYSTEM, we're in a new UMB.
 33041                                  fu20:	
 33042                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 33043                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 33044                                  	; 19/07/2023
 33045 00002D68 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end 
 33046 00002D6E 7408                    	je	short fuE	; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 33047                                  
 33048                                  	;NextMCB es,ax		; Go on forward.
 33049                                  	; 22/07/2023
 33050                                  	; ax = es
 33051                                  	;mov	ax,es ; * ; 22/07/2023
 33052                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 33053 00002D70 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 33054 00002D75 40                      	inc	ax
 33055                                  	; 22/07/2023
 33056                                  	;mov	es,ax ; **
 33057 00002D76 EBE4                    	jmp	short fu10
 33058                                  fuE:	
 33059 00002D78 F9                      	stc
 33060                                  fuX:
 33061                                  	; 01/01/2023
 33062                                  	;pop	dx
 33063                                  	; 02/01/2023
 33064 00002D79 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 33065                                  	;pop	ax		; The address is already in ES.
 33066 00002D7A C3                      	retn
 33067                                  
 33068                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33069                                  ;*** BigFree - makes ES:0 point to the largest free MCB in UMB given as AL
 33070                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33071                                  ; ENTRY:    AL should be to a valid UMB number
 33072                                  ; EXIT:     ES:0 points to largest free MCB in UMB, AX returns its size
 33073                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if couldn't reach UMB (0 or too high)
 33074                                  ; USES:     Flags, ES
 33075                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33076                                  
 33077                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 33078                                  BigFree:
 33079                                  	; 01/01/2023
 33080                                  	;push	bx
 33081 00002D7B 51                      	push	cx
 33082                                  
 33083 00002D7C E8D3FF                  	call	findUMB			; Returns with CF if err, else ES==MCB
 33084 00002D7F 723A                    	jc	short bfX		; (would be "jc bfE"; it just does stc)
 33085                                  
 33086 00002D81 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; Segment address of largest free MCB
 33087 00002D83 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			; Size of largest free MCB
 33088                                  
 33089                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 33090                                  ; BF10--ES - Current MCB address
 33091                                  ;       BX - Address of largest free MCB so far
 33092                                  ;       CX - Size of largest free MCB so far
 33093                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 33094                                  
 33095                                  bf10:	
 33096 00002D85 E8B1FE                  	call	isSysMCB		; If we've left the MCB, we're done.
 33097 00002D88 7428                    	jz	short bf30
 33098                                  
 33099                                  	;call	isFreeMCB		; Returns with ZF set if owner is 0
 33100 00002D8A 26830E010000            	or	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],0
 33101 00002D90 750C                    	jnz	short bf20
 33102                                  
 33103 00002D92 26A10300                	mov	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 33104                                  	;cmp	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Compare sizes...
 33105 00002D96 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 33106                                  	;jg	short bf20		; Unless we're bigger,
 33107                                  	; 19/07/2023
 33108 00002D98 7D04                    	jge	short bf20
 33109                                  
 33110 00002D9A 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Store this new element's address,
 33111                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; and its size.
 33112 00002D9C 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 33113                                  
 33114                                  bf20:	
 33115                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 33116                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end	; 'Z'
 33117                                  	; 19/07/2023
 33118                                  	;cmp	byte [es:0],'Z'
 33119 00002D9E 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end
 33120 00002DA4 740C                    	jz	short bf30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB.
 33121                                  
 33122                                  	;NextMCB es,ax			; Go on forward.
 33123 00002DA6 8CC0                    	mov     ax,es
 33124                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 33125 00002DA8 2603060300              	add     ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 33126 00002DAD 40                      	inc     ax
 33127 00002DAE 8EC0                    	mov     es,ax
 33128                                  
 33129 00002DB0 EBD3                    	jmp	short bf10
 33130                                  
 33131 00002DB2 8EC3                    bf30:	mov	es,bx			; Return the address
 33132 00002DB4 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx			; Return the size
 33133 00002DB6 09DB                    	or	bx,bx
 33134 00002DB8 7501                    	jnz	short bfX		; (if size==0, there's nothing free)
 33135                                  bfE:	
 33136 00002DBA F9                      	stc
 33137                                  bfX:
 33138 00002DBB 59                      	pop	cx
 33139                                  	; 01/01/2023
 33140                                  	;pop	bx
 33141 00002DBC C3                      	retn
 33142                                  
 33143                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33144                                  ;*** isSpecified - sets ZF if UMB in AL wasn't specified in DH/LH line.
 33145                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33146                                  ; ENTRY:    AL should be to a valid UMB number
 33147                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if UMB wasn't specified, ZF clear if it was
 33148                                  ; ERROR:    None
 33149                                  ; USES:     Flags
 33150                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33151                                  
 33152                                  	; 02/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 33153                                  
 33154                                  isSpecified:
 33155                                  	; 02/01/2023
 33156                                  	;push	ax
 33157                                  
 33158 00002DBD 30FF                    	xor	bh,bh
 33159 00002DBF 88C3                    	mov	bl,al
 33160                                  
 33161                                  	;getdata al,DS:UmbUsed[bx]
 33162                                  	;
 33163                                  	;push	ds
 33164                                  	;push	cs
 33165                                  	;pop	ds
 33166                                  	;mov	al,[bx+UmbUsed]
 33167                                  	;pop	ds
 33168                                  	
 33169                                  	;mov	al,[cs:bx+UmbUsed]
 33170                                  	; 02/01/2023
 33171                                  	; ds = cs
 33172 00002DC1 8A87[2A1F]              	mov	al,[bx+UmbUsed]
 33173                                  
 33174 00002DC5 08C0                    	or	al,al			; Sets ZF if al==0 (ie, if unspecified)
 33175                                  
 33176                                  	; 09/09/2023
 33177                                  	; 02/01/2023
 33178                                  	;pop	ax
 33179                                  
 33180 00002DC7 C3                      	retn
 33181                                  
 33182                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33183                                  ;*** shrinkMCB - breaks an MCB into two pieces, the lowest one's size==AX
 33184                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33185                                  ; ENTRY:    AX == new size, ES:0 == current MCB
 33186                                  ; EXIT:     None; MCB broken if carry clear
 33187                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if MCB isn't as large as AX+0x20 (not a useful split)
 33188                                  ; USES:     Flags
 33189                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33190                                  ; If the size of the to-be-split MCB isn't at least 0x20 bytes greater than
 33191                                  ; the specified new size, the split is useless; if it's only 0x10 bytes, that
 33192                                  ; 0x10 will be used to make a header that mentions a 0-byte free space, and
 33193                                  ; that just sucks up 0x10 bytes for nothing. So we make 0x20 bytes the
 33194                                  ; minimum for performing a split.
 33195                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33196                                  
 33197                                  MIN_SPLIT_SIZE	equ	20h
 33198                                  
 33199                                  	; 02/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 33200                                  
 33201                                  shrinkMCB:
 33202                                  	;pushreg <bx,cx,es>
